title: Portrait, "Empress Eugénie", ca. 1851–1900
medium:
Medium: silk
Technique: predominantly warp-faced plain weave (white) with a continuous supplementary weft (black), variously bound on the front, which on the back outside the picture is bound as plain weave
dimensions: Warp x Weft: 26 x 21.5 cm (10 1/4 x 8 7/16 in.)
description: Black and white jacquard woven portrait of Empress Eugénie of France (1826-1920). Lower half of the portrait is ornamented with sprays of roses, an escutcheon and a ribbon that reads "Eugénie Imperatrice." At the lower left and right are the woven signatures "Carquillat Tex." and "Bruyas del." Woven by Michel-Marie Carquillat (d. 1884) after a portrait by Marc-Laurent Bruyas (1821-1896).

tombstone.epitaph:
Portrait, "Empress Eugénie", ca. 1851–1900.
ca. 1851–1900. Medium: silk
Technique: predominantly warp-faced plain weave (white) with a continuous supplementary weft (black), variously bound on the front, which on the back outside the picture is bound as plain weave. Gift of Anonymous Donor. a-t-774.
